member.name: M:Bitalino.trigger(System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Assigns the digital outputs states.
member.param: Array of booleans to assign to digital outputs, starting at output 0. This array cannot contain more than 4 elements. If the array contains less than 4 elements, the remaining outputs are set to low state.
member.remarks: This method must be called only during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.trigger
member.summary: Resets all digital outputs to low state.
member.remarks: This method must be called only during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.battery(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the battery voltage threshold for the low-battery LED.
member.param: Battery voltage threshold (0...63). 0 corresponds to 3.4 V and 63 corresponds to 3.8 V.
member.remarks: This method cannot be called during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.read(Bitalino.Frame[])
member.summary: Reads acquisition frames from the device. This method does not return until all requested frames are received from the device.
member.param: Array of frames to be filled. This array cannot be empty.
member.remarks: This method must be called only during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.stop
member.summary: Stops a signal acquisition.
member.remarks: This method must be called only during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.start(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts a signal acquisition from the device.
member.param: Sampling rate in Hz. Accepted values are 1, 10, 100 or 1000 Hz.
Set of channels to acquire. Accepted channels are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. If this set is empty, all 6 analog channels will be acquired.
If true, start in simulated mode. Otherwise start in live mode.
member.remarks: This method cannot be called during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.start(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Starts a live signal acquisition from the device.
member.param: Sampling rate in Hz. Accepted values are 1, 10, 100 or 1000 Hz.
Set of channels to acquire. Accepted channels are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. If this set is empty, all 6 analog channels will be acquired.
member.remarks: This method cannot be called during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.start(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts a live signal acquisition from all analog channels on the device.
member.param: Sampling rate in Hz. Accepted values are 1, 10, 100 or 1000 Hz.
member.remarks: This method cannot be called during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.start
member.summary: Starts a live signal acquisition from all analog channels on the device at 1000 Hz.
member.remarks: This method cannot be called during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.version
member.summary: Returns the device firmware version string.
member.remarks: This method cannot be called during an acquisition.

member.name: M:Bitalino.Finalize
member.summary: Disconnects from a BITalino device. If an aquisition is running, it is stopped.

member.name: M:Bitalino.Dispose
member.summary: Disconnects from a BITalino device. If an aquisition is running, it is stopped.

member.name: M:Bitalino.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Connects to a BITalino device.
member.param: The device Bluetooth MAC address ("xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx") or a serial port ("COMx")

member.name: M:Bitalino.find
member.summary: Searches for Bluetooth devices in range.

member.summary: Invalid parameter

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.DEVICE_NOT_IN_ACQUISITION
member.summary: The device is not in acquisition mode

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.DEVICE_NOT_IDLE
member.summary: The device is not idle

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.PORT_INITIALIZATION
member.summary: The communication port could not be initialized

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.PORT_COULD_NOT_BE_OPENED
member.summary: The communication port does not exist or it is already being used

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.CONTACTING_DEVICE
member.summary: The computer lost communication with the device

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.DEVICE_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: The device could not be found

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.BT_ADAPTER_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: No Bluetooth adapter was found

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.INVALID_ADDRESS
member.summary: The specified address is invalid

member.name: F:Bitalino.Exception.Code.INSTANCE_CLOSED
member.summary: The object instance is closed

member.name: F:Bitalino.Frame.analog
member.summary: Array of analog inputs values (0...1023 or 0...63)

member.name: F:Bitalino.Frame.digital
member.summary: Array of digital inputs states (false or true)

member.name: F:Bitalino.Frame.seq
member.summary: Frame sequence number (0..15)

member.name: F:Bitalino.DevInfo.name
member.summary: name of a Bluetooth device

member.name: F:Bitalino.DevInfo.macAddr
member.summary: MAC address of a Bluetooth device

member.name: T:Bitalino
member.summary: The BITalino device class.

members.member: Assigns the digital outputs states. \param[in] digitalOutput Vector of booleans to assign to digital outputs, starting at output 0. This vector cannot contain more than 4 elements. If the vector contains less than 4 elements, the remaining outputs are set to low state. If this parameter is not given, all digital outputs are set to low state. \remarks This method must be called only during an acquisition. \exception Exception (Exception::DEVICE_NOT_IN_ACQUISITION) \exception Exception (Exception::INVALID_PARAMETER) \exception Exception (Exception::CONTACTING_DEVICE)

Sets the battery voltage threshold for the low-battery LED. \param[in] value Battery voltage threshold. Default value is 0. Value | Voltage Threshold ----- | ----------------- 0 | 3.4 V ... | ... 63 | 3.8 V \remarks This method cannot be called during an acquisition. \exception Exception (Exception::DEVICE_NOT_IDLE) \exception Exception (Exception::INVALID_PARAMETER) \exception Exception (Exception::CONTACTING_DEVICE)

Reads acquisition frames from the device. This method does not return until all requested frames are received from the device. \param[out] frames Vector of frames to be filled. If the vector is empty, it is resized to 100 frames. \remarks This method must be called only during an acquisition. \exception Exception (Exception::DEVICE_NOT_IN_ACQUISITION) \exception Exception (Exception::CONTACTING_DEVICE)

Stops a signal acquisition. \remarks This method must be called only during an acquisition. \exception Exception (Exception::DEVICE_NOT_IN_ACQUISITION) \exception Exception (Exception::CONTACTING_DEVICE)

Starts a signal acquisition from the device. \param[in] samplingRate Sampling rate in Hz. Accepted values are 1, 10, 100 or 1000 Hz. Default value is 1000 Hz. \param[in] channels Set of channels to acquire. Accepted channels are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. If this set is empty or if it is not given, all 6 analog channels will be acquired. \param[in] simulated If true, start in simulated mode. Otherwise start in live mode. Default is to start in live mode. \remarks This method cannot be called during an acquisition. \exception Exception (Exception::DEVICE_NOT_IDLE) \exception Exception (Exception::INVALID_PARAMETER) \exception Exception (Exception::CONTACTING_DEVICE)

Returns the device firmware version string. \remarks This method cannot be called during an acquisition. \exception Exception (Exception::DEVICE_NOT_IDLE) \exception Exception (Exception::CONTACTING_DEVICE)
Disconnects from a %BITalino device. If an aquisition is running, it is stopped.

Connects to a %BITalino device. \param[in] address The device Bluetooth MAC address ("xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx") or a serial port ("COMx" on Windows or "/dev/..." on Linux or Mac OS X) \exception Exception (Exception::PORT_COULD_NOT_BE_OPENED) \exception Exception (Exception::PORT_INITIALIZATION) \exception Exception (Exception::INVALID_ADDRESS) \exception Exception (Exception::BT_ADAPTER_NOT_FOUND) - Windows only \exception Exception (Exception::DEVICE_NOT_FOUND) - Windows only
Searches for Bluetooth devices in range. \return a list of found devices \exception Exception (Exception::PORT_INITIALIZATION) \exception Exception (Exception::BT_ADAPTER_NOT_FOUND)
